intro: Espinhassoa rhombiglossa, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a woody stem with thorny branches, which gives it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth surface. Espinhassoa rhombiglossa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display.
